meanings.definition: The plural form of 'loof', meaning the palm of the hand.
meanings.sent1: She gently placed the coin in the loofs of her friend's hands.
meanings.sent2: The baby held onto her mother's loofs tightly.
meanings.sent3: The magician made the coin disappear into the loofs of the volunteer's hands.
meanings.sent4: His loofs were rough from years of hard work.
meanings.sent5: The loofs of the giant statue were big enough to hold a person.

meanings.definition: The plural form of 'loof', meaning the underside of a bird's wing.
meanings.sent1: The loofs of the seagull were white and graceful in flight.
meanings.sent2: The ornithologist carefully examined the loofs of the injured bird.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to hide nuts under the loofs of the pigeons.
meanings.sent4: The loofs of the eagle glided effortlessly through the sky.
meanings.sent5: The loofs of the owl were silent as it swooped down to catch its prey.
